meanings.definition: The killing of a large number of people
meanings.sent1: The battlefield was filled with carnage after the fierce battle.
meanings.sent2: The news reported the carnage caused by the natural disaster.
meanings.sent3: The movie exaggerated the carnage to create suspense.
meanings.sent4: The aftermath of the war left behind a trail of carnage.
meanings.sent5: The history books vividly described the carnage of the ancient wars.

meanings.definition: The slaughter of a great number of people, as in battle; butchery; massacre
meanings.sent1: The village was in shock after the brutal carnage by the invaders.
meanings.sent2: The carnage on the battlefield was a grim reminder of the harsh reality of war.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie depicted unrealistic carnage for shock value.
meanings.sent4: The carnage of the battlefield painted a grim picture of the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the carnage of the historic event with great detail.
